intro: Laserpitium leucolaenum, commonly known as the white meadow grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in supporting pollinators and its resilience to environmental changes.
